title: DermaCon-IN: A Multi-concept Annotated Dermatological Image Dataset of Indian Skin Disorders for Clinical AI Research
authors: Shanawaj S. Madarkar*, Mahajabeen Madarkar*, Madhumitha V*, Teli Prakash, Konda Reddy Mopuri, et al.
blurb: Introduces a multi-concept dermatology dataset centered on Indian skin disorders, enabling clinically relevant benchmarking and richer supervision beyond class labels.

title: Rel-SA: Alzheimer’s Disease Detection using Relevance-augmented Self Attention by Inducing Domain Priors in Vision Transformers
authors: Madhumitha V*, Shanawaj S. Madarkar*, Sunayna Padhye*, Susmit Agrawal, Konda Reddy Mopuri
blurb: Injects domain priors into transformer attention for T1w sMRI-based AD detection, aiming for stronger inductive bias and more meaningful relevance patterns.

title: Can memory networks play a role in task-specific modulation of neural circuits?
authors: Susmit Agrawal, Krishn Vishwas Kher, Madhumitha V, Vineeth N. Balasubramanian
blurb: Explores whether memory-augmented architectures can support task-specific modulation behaviors, connecting model mechanisms to neural-circuit hypotheses.

title: Detecting Alzheimer’s disease with Efficient ViTs
authors: Shanawaj S. Madarkar, Madhumitha V, Sunayna Padhye, Konda Reddy Mopuri
blurb: Investigates lightweight vision transformers for AD detection, emphasizing compute-aware modeling and practical deployment constraints.

title: URVoice: An Akl-Toussaint / Graham-Sklansky Optimization for Sign Language Interpretation
authors: Madhumitha V, Santhi Natarajan, Bharathi A, Manjunath Sargur Krishnamurthy
blurb: Proposes an optimization-based approach for sign language interpretation, focusing on efficient sequence/structure handling in a biomedical informatics setting.

title: Machine Learning Approach for Diagnosis of Schizophrenia Using EEG Signals
authors: I. S. Rajesh, D. Sri Lakshmi Priya, V. Madhumitha, Shreyas Sreenivas
blurb: Uses EEG-derived signals for schizophrenia classification with traditional machine learning baselines and feature-driven evaluation.

title: A Comparative Study for Early Diagnosis of Alzheimer’s Disease Using Machine Learning Techniques
authors: A. Bharathi Malakreddy, D. Sri Lakshmi Priya, V. Madhumitha, Aryan Tiwari
blurb: Compares machine learning approaches for early AD screening, highlighting feature/model tradeoffs for demented vs non-demented categorization.
